sn22.96:4.2: Seated at one side that mendicant said to the Buddha:
sn22.96:4.3: “Sir, is there any form at all that’s permanent, everlasting, eternal, imperishable, and will last forever and ever?
sn22.96:4.7: consciousness at all that’s permanent, everlasting, eternal, imperishable, and will last forever and ever?”
sn22.96:4.8: “Mendicant, there is no form at all that’s permanent, everlasting, eternal, imperishable, and will last forever and ever.
sn22.96:4.12: consciousness at all that’s permanent, everlasting, eternal, imperishable, and will last forever and ever.”
sn22.96:5.1: Then the Buddha, picking up a lump of cow dung, said to the mendicants:
sn22.96:5.2: “There’s not even this much of any incarnation that’s permanent, everlasting, eternal, imperishable, and will last forever and ever.
sn22.96:5.3: If there was, this living of the spiritual life for the complete ending of suffering would not be found.
sn22.96:5.4: But since there isn’t, this living of the spiritual life for the complete ending of suffering is found.
sn22.96:6.1: Once upon a time I was an anointed aristocratic king.
sn22.96:6.2: I had 84,000 cities, with the capital Kusāvatī foremost.
sn22.96:6.3: I had 84,000 mansions, with the mansion named Principle foremost.
sn22.96:6.4: I had 84,000 bungalows, with the bungalow named Great Formation foremost.
sn22.96:6.5: I had 84,000 couches made of ivory or heartwood or gold or silver, spread with woolen covers—shag-piled or embroidered with flowers—and spread with a fine deer hide, with a canopy above and red pillows at both ends.
sn22.96:6.6: I had 84,000 bull elephants with gold adornments and banners, covered with gold netting, with the royal bull elephant named Sabbath foremost.
sn22.96:6.7: I had 84,000 horses with gold adornments and banners, covered with gold netting, with the royal horse named Thundercloud foremost.
sn22.96:6.8: I had 84,000 chariots with gold adornments and banners, covered with gold netting, with the chariot named Victory foremost.
sn22.96:6.9: I had 84,000 jewels, with the Jewel Treasure foremost.
sn22.96:6.10: I had 84,000 women, with Queen Subhaddā foremost.
sn22.96:6.12: I had 84,000 aristocrat vassals, with the Counselor Treasure foremost.
sn22.96:6.14: I had 84,000 milk cows with jute ropes and bronze pails.
sn22.96:6.16: I had 8,400,000,000 fine cloths of linen, silk, wool, and cotton.
sn22.96:6.18: I had 84,000 servings of food, which were presented to me as offerings in the morning and evening.
sn22.96:7.1: Of those 84,000 cities, I only stayed in one, the capital Kusāvatī.
sn22.96:7.3: Of those 84,000 mansions, I only stayed in one, the mansion named “Principle”.
sn22.96:7.5: Of those 84,000 bungalows, I only stayed in one, the bungalow named  Great Formation.
sn22.96:7.7: Of those 84,000 couches, I only used one, made of ivory or heartwood or gold or silver.
sn22.96:7.9: Of those 84,000 bull elephants, I only rode one, the royal bull elephant named Sabbath.
sn22.96:7.11: Of those 84,000 horses, I only rode one, the royal horse named Thundercloud.
sn22.96:7.13: Of those 84,000 chariots, I only rode one, the chariot named Triumph.
sn22.96:7.15: Of those 84,000 women, I was only served by one, a maiden of the aristocratic or merchant classes.
sn22.96:7.17: Of those 8,400,000,000 cloths, I only used one pair, made of fine linen, silk, wool, or cotton.
sn22.96:7.19: Of those 84,000 servings of food, I only had one, eating at most a serve of rice and suitable sauce.
sn22.96:7.20: And so all those conditioned phenomena have passed, ceased, and perished.
sn22.96:7.24: This is quite enough for you to become disillusioned, dispassionate, and freed from all conditions.”
